vulnerable_road_users.description: A cyclist on the right side of the ego car is stationary or moving slowly with a loaded cart attached to the cycle. The cyclist is positioned partially on the roadway and partially on the side of the road.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The presence of the cyclist and their cart is a potential hazard, and can influence the available width of the driving lane, requiring the ego car to potentially navigate around them with caution.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the provided traffic image, there is a cyclist on the right side of the ego car who is either stationary or moving slowly with a loaded cart attached to the cycle. The cyclist is positioned partially on the roadway and partially on the side of the road. The presence of the cyclist and their cart poses a potential hazard, influencing the available width of the driving lane and requiring the ego car to navigate around them with caution.

1.description and explanation: A motorized tricycle with a cargo bed is visible, typically used for transporting goods or materials. The operator is seated at the front, controlling the vehicle. Due to the size and the potential slow movement of this tricycle, the ego car must maintain a safe distance and be prepared for unexpected stops or turns that the tricycle might make, ensuring safe passage around it if overtaking is necessary and legal to do so.

2.description and explanation: This is a three-wheeled vehicle, often referred to as a tricycle, that is being used to transport goods. Given the size of the load being carried, it likely moves at a slower pace than standard vehicles. Therefore, the ego car should maintain a safe distance, reduce speed if necessary, and exercise caution to allow for ample reaction time in case the tricycle makes any sudden stops or turns.

driving_suggestion: Proceed with caution, maintaining a slower speed to ensure there is sufficient time to react to the cyclist or any other unforeseen obstacles. If passing the cyclist, ensure there is enough clearance space to do so safely, and be prepared for potential movements from them. Clean the windshield at the earliest opportunity to improve visibility. The ego car should maintain a safe distance from the cyclist and be prepared to slow down or stop if the cyclist makes any unexpected movements. The vehicle should also reduce speed appropriately due to the reduced visibility from the weather conditions and continue to monitor the environment for any other potential hazards.
